locutie.beschrijving: A funeral eulogy for Samuel Proctor, interpreting his life through the lens of 'faithfulness unto death' and the promise of a crown of life.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. The preacher focuses on a single verse (Rev 2:10) and applies it biographically rather than contextually, though the distinction between 'until' and 'unto' is exegetically sharp.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily eulogizing and testifying to the character of the deceased, shifting at the end to a personal request/hope for reunion.
voorbeelden: I want today to thank you
Be thou faithful unto death
I speak now to his spirit
Meet me there

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Consolation for the bereaved, inspiration to emulate Proctor's faithfulness, and a sense of hope in the afterlife.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is mentioned as a historical actor in the text or in Proctor's life, but not explicitly as the agent of the current sermon event.

voorbeelden: Something vast and noble has passed from among us.
He was born in the Tidewater.
He never gave up.
Please come to the terminal.
Do not stay in the terminal.
Meet me there.
I want today to thank you.
I will carry to my dying day the memory.
God be thanked for that.
I will give thee a crown of life.
I will reward you.
We'll go to see Jesus.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are largely quoted from Scripture or projected into the future/afterlife rather than being enacted 'now' for the congregation.

voorbeelden: We bid his spirit farewell today.
I speak now to a liberated, redeemed, emancipated spirit.
Amen.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher exercises authority in 'speaking to the spirit' of the deceased, a quasi-liturgical declaration.

indicatoren: Metaphorical descriptions of the deceased ('mighty oak', 'meteor').
Past-tense narrative of Proctor's travels and work.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of a life well-lived rather than a participant in a current divine encounter.

missende_elementen: Direct address to the congregation (2nd person plural).
Present-tense absolution or promise to the living.
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is comforted by a story, but not necessarily addressed by God.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: The promises are primarily directed toward the deceased (Proctor) or the preacher himself, rather than the congregation.
voorbeelden: I will give thee a crown of life.
I will reward you.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher's personal memories and his own future hope.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the family (briefly) and to the spirit of Sam Proctor (extensively).
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used in the 'farewell' and 'meet me' sections.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing Sam Proctor and his attributes.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a hagiographic distance; the sermon is about a hero, not the hearer.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about faithfulness and racism.

actueel_present.gebruik: The act of bidding farewell and the final appeal.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Proctor was great) -> Directive (Sam, meet me in heaven).
voorbeelden: He was faithful... So will you, old friend... meet me there.
foutief_patroon.probleem: The congregation is largely bypassed in the performative movement; the 'event' is between the preacher and the deceased.

sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Weak. Lacks a clear transition from the indicative of Christ's work to the declarative for the hearer.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: Faithfulness is within the grasp of the least of us (Assertive/General) -> Be thou faithful (Directive).

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a powerful personal testimony and eulogy, but remains stuck in 'talking about' the deceased rather than 'proclaiming to' the living.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: mighty oak has fallen, leaving an empty and gaping and glaring space against the sky
sterke_punten.effect: Creates profound emotional resonance and dignity.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: So will you, old friend, will you, come out to the arrival gate.
zwakke_punten.probleem: The climax of the sermon excludes the congregation; they are eavesdropping on a private conversation.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is an 'event' of mourning and tribute, but less so a 'sacramental event' of the Word addressing the sinner/saint.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The 'Toezegging' (Promise) is applied to Proctor, not the congregation.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the source of the quote, but the preacher is the primary speaker.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher speaks 'on behalf of Christendom', claiming a representative role.
tekstueel_bewijs: on behalf of Christendom... I want today to thank you

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, as an 'inoculation' against racism and the voice in the text.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the 'Spirit of Christ' that flows through bloodstreams.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Low. The sermon is more a monument than a means of grace.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: High in imagery, low in direct address.
tekstueel_bewijs: hills of Zion yield a thousand sacred sweets

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by past-tense 'to be' and 'to do' verbs describing Proctor. It needs more present-tense 'to give' and 'to declare' verbs directed at the audience.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: Faithfulness is within the grasp of the least of us.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, Christ grants you the same faithfulness He gave to Sam.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a general truth (Assertive) to a specific gift (Commissive/Declarative).

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise of the 'crown of life' is treated as a reward for Proctor's merit.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Apply the promise of Revelation 2:10 to the grieving congregation directly.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you who feel the 'gaping space' in the sky, Christ promises: I will not leave you orphans.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: The 'You' in the second half is almost exclusively the deceased.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use the 'You' to address the congregation's fear of death.
voorbeeldzinnen: You do not need to fear the arrival gate, for the King meets you there.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative 'Be thou faithful' is presented as a task to be emulated based on Proctor's example.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ground the faithfulness in Christ's faithfulness to the hearer.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A rhetorically magnificent tribute that succeeds as a eulogy but requires a stronger illocutionary shift toward the congregation to function as a sacramental sermon event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' of grief; SAT reveals that the preacher is attempting a Declarative act of 'bidding farewell' to a spirit.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric admires the 'mighty oak' metaphor; SAT asks if the metaphor performs anything for the hearer's standing before God.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT exposes that the sermon's climax is a 'pseudo-directive' (asking a dead man to meet him) which, while moving, lacks the illocutionary force of a Gospel promise to the living.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: Be thou faithful unto death, and I will give thee a crown of life.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High, but limited by its application to the deceased.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Epideictic' rhetoric (praise/blame) which, in SAT terms, results in a Constative Surplus because it describes a finished life rather than enacting a present grace.
